summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York inquiring about the protocol for delivering a hard drive containing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The email seeks confirmation that the hard drive must be non-encrypted and without password protection, and expresses urgency to deliver the materials the following day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at MDC to whom discovery materials on a hard drive need to be delivered.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is coordinating the delivery of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is responsible for providing discovery materials to the defendant as part of the legal process.

events.title: Inquiry about discovery delivery to Maxwell
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails to inquire about the protocol for delivering a hard drive with discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Prosecutors were preparing to deliver discovery materials on a hard drive to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC in August 2020.
The protocol required the hard drive to be non-encrypted and without password protection for inmate access.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and discovery obligations in Maxwell's case at that time.
